article_title: Double Down: McCain Mocks Concerns Over Poker Playing During Syria Hearing via Twitter
article_body: On Tuesday, after being caught playing online poker on his iPhone during a Senate Syria hearing, Sen. John McCain (R-AZ) fired back via Twitter:Ben Shapiro is Editor-At-Large of Breitbart News and author of the New York Times bestseller “Bullies: How the Left’s Culture of Fear and Intimidation Silences America” (Threshold Editions, January 8, 2013).
parent_text:
I actually watched the 3 1/2 hour hearings (and I'm not even a Senator).  I suspect most of the people commenting didn't bother to watch.


During the hearing, I got a beer and played some games on my phone.  I even checked out what other shows were on and saw a few minutes of Ellen and Dr Phil.



But I didn't miss much from the hearing.  The same 3 or 4 questions were being asked over and over and over.  And the same answer was given over and over and over.


I'm not a big fan of McCain but I can TOTALLY understand what he did.


BTW - Texting and driving is much more dangerous that playing computer poker in a Senate Committee hearing.
